docs.abstract: Kay Finegan, big band singer who later became one of New York's top caterers, dies at age 95 (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Kay Finegan, a singer and arranger of the big band era who later became one of New York's top caterers, died here on Saturday at the home of a niece. She was 95. A grandson, Patrick Finegan of New York City, announced her death, which followed a long period of declining health.
docs.snippet: Ms. Finegan was a singer and arranger of the big band era who later became one of New York's top caterers....

headline.main: Really No Need to Trek to Afghanistan

docs.lead_paragraph: FAMILIES, many of them Afghani, gather on Sunday nights at Kabul Cuisine in Great Neck. Children were very much in evidence at almost every table on a recent evening. They were seen digging into challows, or Afghani stews, and kebabs with a relish usually reserved for pizzas and hamburgers. The white tablecloths, fresh flowers and candlelight set the stage for a civilized meal, while low prices make Kabul Cuisine affordable enough to take the whole family.

headline.main: The Well-Fed Musketeer; ALEXANDRE DUMAS' DICTIONARY OF CUISINE. Edited, Abridged and Translated by Louis Colman, from the French "Le Grand Dictlonnaire de Cuisine." Illustrations by John H. Jacoby. 282 pp. New YorE: Simon and Schuster. $4.95.

docs.abstract: Alexandre Dumas' Dictionary of Cuisine ed, abridged and tr by L Colman revd
docs.lead_paragraph: " AFTER more than five hundred volumes, I want to close my literary career with a book on cooking." This statement was written to one of his many publishers by Alexandre Dumas (pere), author of "The Three Musketeers," "The Count of Monte Cristo," etc., whose robust, productive and sometimes suspect life was one of the most picturesque of the nineteenth century.

docs.abstract: Joanne Starkey reviews Maroni Cuisine restaurant in Northport, NY; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: DOES a 14-course tasting meal of exceptionally good food sound like fun? We found that to be the case at Maroni Cuisine in Northport. Maroni's is like no other restaurant on Long Island. Some fancy French places and upscale New American spots offer tasting meals, but they are a different breed. Those at sophisticated restaurants usually consist of five to seven courses and may take three hours to complete. At Maroni's the dishes arrive in short order, sometimes two at a time, and number 13 or 14. Still, a meal may be over in one and a half hours.
docs.snippet: DOES a 14-course tasting meal of exceptionally good food sound like fun? We found that to be the case at Maroni Cuisine in Northport....

docs.abstract: Joanne Starkey reviews Cuisine Cucina, bakery-bistro-bar in Rockville Centre, NY (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: CUISINE Cucina is one of those 1990's hybrids. It calls itself a bakery-bistro-bar-market. Diners on their way to tables in the rear of this long, narrow, high-ceilinged Rockville Centre storefront first encounter shelves loaded with imported olive oils, pastas, biscotti and other specialty groceries. Most patrons then pause to make mental choices from the display cases of pastries, cakes and pies. A deli counter, presenting a colorful mosaic of fancy salads, prepared entrees and bowls of olives, is next. The trek continues by the open kitchen, where speedy chefs are tossing pastas and grilling meats, on past the bar and finally to the small rear dining room with its marble top tables and metal chairs.

headline.main: It's All in Knowing How; THE CLASSIC FRENCH CUISINE. By Joseph Donon. Illustrated. 324 pp. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $5.

docs.abstract: Donon, J: The Classic French Cuisine
docs.lead_paragraph: BORN in France seventy-one years ago. Joseph Donon came to this country at the age of 24. Here he has lived and cooked ever since, except for a period during World War I when he returned to France to serve in the army.

headline.main: Review: Belarus Free Theater’s ‘Trash Cuisine’ Serves Politics With Teeth

docs.abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Belarus Free Theater production of play Trash Cuisine, written by Nicolai Khalezin and Natalia Kaliada and directed by Khalezin, at Ellen Stewart Theater.
docs.lead_paragraph: With this show at La MaMa, an attack on institutionalized killing, Belarus Free Theater displays its customary razor-sharp commentary.

docs.lead_paragraph: Seven people, including a 4-year-old boy and four teen-agers, were wounded in bursts of gunfire on a busy Chinatown street last night, and the police later said the shootings were an apparent outbreak of gang warfare. Five of the victims - the child, who was shot in the head; three of the teen-agers, and a 37-year-old man who was shot in the chest as he dined in a restaurant - were listed in critical condition last night. In Chinatown, where youth gangs have been responsible for extortion, murders, kidnappings and other crimes, the shootings were the worst outbreak of violence in more than two years, according to law-enforcement authorities. The number of gunmen was not immediately known, but witnesses told the police they saw at least one assailant running from the shootings, which erupted shortly after 6 P.M. on East Broadway between Catherine and Market Streets, just south of the Manhattan Bridge on Chinatown's southeastern edge.

headline.main: A Whole Lot Of Soul, And a Little Hip-Hop, Too

docs.abstract: Janice Combs, mother of rap artist and entrepreneur Sean Combs, opens Mama Duke Southern Cuisine, small takeout soul food shop in Brooklyn that pays tribute to her mother; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: For Janice Combs, the American dream has always been a family affair. When her son, Sean Combs (lately known as P. Diddy), was climbing the charts as a rap artist and starting out as an entrepreneur, she worked as his stylist and helped manage his restaurant, Justin's. But at Mama Duke Southern Cuisine, a small shop in Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, that serves heaping plates of takeout soul food, she pays tribute to her mother's unfulfilled dream.
